data.chText: 想；认为
data.enText: to think sth or have an opinion about sth

data.chText: 我认为我会得到那份工作。
data.enText: I reckon (that) I'm going to get that job.

data.chText: 总有一天，他会成为名人的。你觉得呢？
data.enText: He'll be famous one day. What do you reckon (= do you agree) ?

data.chText: 我想这值很多钱。
data.enText: It's worth a lot of money, I reckon.

data.chText: “他们永远不会发现。”“是吗？”
data.enText: ‘They'll never find out.’ ‘ You reckon? ’ (= I think you may be wrong about that)

data.chText: 被普遍认为是；被看作是

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be generally considered to be sth

data.chText: 人们认为今天的孩子比过去世故。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: Children are reckoned to be more sophisticated nowadays.

data.chText: 大家都认为那是一次成功。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: It was generally reckoned a success.

data.chText: 料想；预计；指望
data.enText: to expect to do sth

data.chText: 我们预计十点钟以前结束。
data.enText: We reckon to finish by ten.

data.chText: 估算；估计；计算
data.enText: to calculate an amount, a number, etc.

data.chText: 估计地球的年龄大约为46亿年。
data.enText: The age of the earth is reckoned at about 4 600 million years.

data.chText: 他们估计利润至少下降了20%。
data.enText: They reckon (that) their profits are down by at least 20%.

data.chText: 路上估计要花大约两个小时。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The journey was reckoned to take about two hours.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。

data.enText: reckon on sth

data.chText: 指望；依赖
data.enText: to expect sth to happen or to rely on sth happening

data.chText: 他们没有料到会发生叛乱。
data.enText: They hadn't reckoned on a rebellion.

data.chText: 我们原指望会有好天气。
data.enText: We'd reckoned on having good weather.
reckon sth↔up

data.chText: 统计；合计
data.enText: to calculate the total amount or number of sth

data.chText: 他在脑子里把所有费用都合计了一下。
data.enText: He reckoned up the cost of everything in his mind.
reckon with sb/sth

data.chText: 重视；认真处理
data.enText: to consider or treat sb/sth as a serious opponent, problem , etc.

data.chText: 他们已经成为一支不容忽视的政治力量。
data.enText: They were already a political force to be reckoned with .

data.chText: 把（可能出现的问题）考虑进去
data.enText: to consider sth as a possible problem that you should be prepared for

data.chText: 我没有考虑到塞车会这么严重。
data.enText: I didn't reckon with getting caught up in so much traffic.
reckon without sb/sth

data.chText: 没考虑到；不把…算在内
data.enText: to not consider sb/sth as a possible problem that you should be prepared for

data.chText: 他们没料到会遭到坚决反对。
data.enText: They had reckoned without the determination of the opposition.

data.text: think ♦ believe ♦ feel ♦ reckon ♦ be under the impression ♦ be of the opinion

data.chText: 以上各词均含以为、认为之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to have an idea that sth is true or possible or to have a particular opinion about sb/sth.
think

data.chText: 指以为、认为某人／事物…，但不肯定：
data.enText: to have an idea that sth is true or possible, although you are not completely certain; to have a particular opinion about sb/sth

data.chText: 你认为他们会来吗？
data.enText: Do you think (that) they'll come?

data.chText: 嗯，我喜欢这个。你认为怎么样？
data.enText: Well, I like it. What do you think?
believe

data.chText: 指以为、认为某人／事物…，但不肯定：
data.enText: to have an idea that sth is true or possible, although you are not completely certain; to have a particular opinion about sb/sth

data.chText: 警方认为那个人可能携有武器。
data.enText: Police believe (that) the man may be armed.

data.chText: 用think还是believe？
表达自己或别人认为真实或有可能的想法时，believe较think正式。believe尤用于别人的想法；think较常用于自己的想法：
data.enText: When you are expressing an idea that you have or that sb has of what is true or possible, believe is more formal than think . It is used especially for talking about ideas that other people have; think is used more often for talking about your own ideas.

data.chText: 警方认为…
data.enText: Police believe…

data.chText: 我认为…
data.enText: I think…

data.chText: 表达意见时，believe语气较think强烈，尤用于原则性事情；think多用于实际事情或个人喜好。
data.enText: When you are expressing an opinion, believe is stronger than think and is used especially for matters of principle; think is used more for practical matters or matters of personal taste.
think or believe?
feel

data.chText: 指认为（已发生的事情…）、相信（应该…）：
data.enText: to have a particular opinion about sth that has happened or about what you/sb ought to do

data.chText: 我们都认为输了是运气不好。
data.enText: We all felt (that) we were unlucky to lose.
reckon

data.chText: 指认为、以为：
data.enText: ( informal ) to think that sth is true or possible

data.chText: 我认为我会得到那份工作。
data.enText: I reckon (that) I'm going to get that job.
be under the impression that…

data.chText: 指以为某事…：
data.enText: to have an idea that sth is true

data.chText: 我还以为已经完工了呢。
data.enText: I was under the impression that the work had already been completed.
be of the opinion that…

data.chText: 指相信、认为：
data.enText: ( formal ) to believe or think that…

data.chText: 我们认为处理这事应该非常谨慎。
data.enText: We are of the opinion that great caution should be exercised in dealing with this matter.
to think/believe/feel/reckon/be under the impression/be of the opinion that…
It is thought/believed/reckoned that…
to be thought/believed/felt/reckoned to be sth
to think/believe/feel sth about sb/sth
to firmly think/believe/feel/be under the impression/be of the opinion
to mistakenly think/believe/feel/be under the impression
to sincerely think/believe/feel/hold
to strongly feel/be of the opinion
reckon on sth

data.chText: 指望；依赖
data.enText: to expect sth to happen or to rely on sth happening

data.chText: 他们没有料到会发生叛乱。
data.enText: They hadn't reckoned on a rebellion.

data.chText: 我们原指望会有好天气。
data.enText: We'd reckoned on having good weather.
reckon sth↔up

data.chText: 统计；合计
data.enText: to calculate the total amount or number of sth

data.chText: 他在脑子里把所有费用都合计了一下。
data.enText: He reckoned up the cost of everything in his mind.
reckon with sb/sth

data.chText: 重视；认真处理
data.enText: to consider or treat sb/sth as a serious opponent, problem , etc.

data.chText: 他们已经成为一支不容忽视的政治力量。
data.enText: They were already a political force to be reckoned with .

data.chText: 把（可能出现的问题）考虑进去
data.enText: to consider sth as a possible problem that you should be prepared for

data.chText: 我没有考虑到塞车会这么严重。
data.enText: I didn't reckon with getting caught up in so much traffic.
reckon without sb/sth

data.chText: 没考虑到；不把…算在内
data.enText: to not consider sb/sth as a possible problem that you should be prepared for

data.chText: 他们没料到会遭到坚决反对。
data.enText: They had reckoned without the determination of the opposition.

example: I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel
I thought to find her in a bad state
he didn't think to find her in the kitchen
I guess she is angry at me for standing her up

tr: make a mathematical calculation or computation

example: She views this quite differently from me
I consider her to be shallow
I don't see the situation quite as negatively as you do
You have to reckon with our opponents
you can count on me to help you any time
Look to your friends for support
Depend on your family in times of crisis

value.def: If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true.

example.ex: Toni reckoned that it must be about three o'clock...
example.tran: 托妮估计当时肯定是3点钟左右。

example.ex: He reckoned he was still fond of her.
example.tran: 他认为自己还喜欢着她。

value.def: If you say that something is reckoned to be true, you mean that people think that it is true.

example.ex: The sale has been held up because the price is reckoned to be too high.
example.tran: 销售陷入停滞，因为大家认为价格太高了。

value.def: If you say that someone reckons to do something, you mean that they expect to do it.

example.ex: The merged banks reckon to raise 4 billion dollars of new equity next year...
example.tran: 几家银行合并后明年有望增发40亿美元的新股。

example.ex: Police officers on the case are reckoning to charge someone very shortly.
example.tran: 调查这个案子的警官正在考虑尽快起诉嫌疑人。

value.def: If something is reckoned to be a particular figure, it is calculated to be roughly that amount.

example.ex: The star's surface temperature is reckoned to be minus 75 degrees Celsius...
example.tran: 这颗恒星的表面温度估计在零下75摄氏度左右。

example.ex: There was a proportion of research, which I reckoned at not more than 30 percent, that was basic research.
example.tran: 我估计基础研究的比例最多只占30％。
